alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 10 at 2:59PM PST until March 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades. This includes the Crater Lake area, highway 62, 230, and 138. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
